result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damontay Lewis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damontay Lewis in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tufford in court for the State of Wisconsin.   With the court's approval, this matter was scheduled off the record.  With discussion between the Court and state, the court adjourned this matter for pre trial conference in Br 45.  Defense counsel was emailed with new court date.  mn
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Evelina Chambers or ANS.Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Damontay Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for Damontay Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that due to the intake calendar of the week, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
